body:
@kylecnewton please fill out the template correctly, otherwise it is hard to help.

also, please use the API as suggested; to use the tracklet stitcher you should be doing: 
```
deeplabcut.stitch_tracklets(config_path, pickle_file, n_tracks=n)
```

Hey @kylecnewton, do you have unique body parts defined in the config? There are apparently 2 tracklets to reconstruct a full track, and that should not be a problem unless they overlap (which should not happen with a single animal). ðŸ¤”

Hi @jeylau , not that I can see but below is what I have in the config file. Just a reminder: this worked perfectly for all the other 650 videos I processed. Weird. 

If it helps, I can share any file necessary with a link to a folder on my google drive.

----------------

individuals:
- Fish1

uniquebodyparts: []
multianimalbodyparts:
- LeftEye
- RightEye
- SwimBladder
- Tail1
- Tail2
- Tail3
- Tail4

skeleton:
- - LeftEye
  - RightEye
- - RightEye
  - SwimBladder
- - Tail2
  - Tail3
- - Tail3
  - Tail4
- - RightEye
  - Tail2
- - LeftEye
  - Tail4
- - SwimBladder
  - Tail2
- - SwimBladder
  - Tail1
- - LeftEye
  - Tail3
- - RightEye
  - Tail4
- - LeftEye
  - Tail2
- - LeftEye
  - Tail1
- - Tail1
  - Tail2
- - LeftEye
  - SwimBladder

bodyparts: MULTI!
start: 0
stop: 1
numframes2pick: 20
Hey @kylecnewton, could you share with me the faulty pickle file at jessy@deeplabcut.org? I could not reproduce the error ðŸ˜•

I figured out what's wrong and I can't believe I didn't think about it earlier. ðŸ˜… When we attempt to reconstruct a single track, `split_tracklets` is set to False with the idea that a single animal's tracklets are not ambiguous and should thus be used as is by the Stitcher. This should be the default behavior though as it works great in most cases, but in your case, just pass `stitch_tracklets(..., split_tracklets=False)` and you'll be fine!

Hi @jeylau it kinda works for a couple files if I set the number of tracks to 2, but I keep getting errors. I've tried all permutations of setting split_tracklets=True or False and n_tracks=1 or 2. 

Here is the code:

python
import deeplabcut
from deeplabcut import stitch_tracklets
from deeplabcut.utils import grab_files_in_folder

for pickle_file in grab_files_in_folder(r'C:\Users\Fish_Behavior\Desktop\DLCwork\1LZF_DLCma_model-Kyle-2020-07-29\videos\batch_process\retry', ext='_el.pickle', relative=False):
   stitch_tracklets(r'C:\Users\Fish_Behavior\Desktop\DLCwork\1LZF_DLCma_model-Kyle-2020-07-29\config.yaml', pickle_file, n_tracks=1, split_tracklets=False)


Here are the errors:

  File "C:\Users\Fish_Behavior\.conda\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\internals\construction.py", line 234, in init_ndarray
    return create_block_manager_from_blocks(block_values, [columns, index])
  File "C:\Users\Fish_Behavior\.conda\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\internals\managers.py", line 1639, in create_block_manager_from_blocks
    raise construction_error(tot_items, blocks[0].shape[1:], axes, e)
ValueError: Shape of passed values is (2400, 21), indices imply (2400, 18)
>>>
Why would you pass `n_tracks=2`? I thought you had only an animal visible in the scene.
I do only have one fish but DLC tracks the fish and the debris as two separate objects - take a look at the detection check videos in the link to the box folder
Unless debris are meant to be tracked, pass n_tracks=1; DeepLabCut knows how to get rid of false detections. I tried it on the 3 problematic files you shared with me and had no errors â˜ºï¸

issue.title: Allow splitting a single animal's tracklets

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

body: It should be fine with #1338; `split_tracklets` will not be forced to False any longer.

@jeylau I have the exact same issue with a small number of my videos. I added `split_tracklets=False` to the command `deeplabcut.stitch_tracklets` but this did not help. I also tried deleting the .pickle files generated and re-running `deeplabcut.analyze_videos` and this also did not help avoid the problem.

What is the fix for this? I am confused by this thread. I am tracking a single animal in addition to an insect, which I treat as an 'object' in my maDLC model. Thank you!
